Title: Ogun governor mourns Segun Awolowo
Summary: Governor Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State has described the passing of Mr. Olusegun Awolowo Jr., grandson of the late Nigerian nationalist and statesman, Chief Obafemi Awo, as a deeply personal loss .

Title: Peter Obi calls for decisive investment in education
Summary: Presidential candidate of the Labour Party in the 2023 elections, Peter Obi, has said Nigeria cannot achieve meaningful national transformation without decisive and sustained investment in education . Speaking at the National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools (NAPPS) International Conference .

Title: US peace plan ‘good’ for Russia, Ukraine: White House
Summary: A US peace plan backed by President Donald Trump is being negotiated with Russia and Ukraine . The White House rejects concerns that it echoes many of Moscow’s demands . Trump's special envoy Steve Steyer says the peace plan is ‘good’ for both sides .

Title: Ex-legislators fault call on Tinubu to resign over Kebbi, Kwara attacks
Summary: Ex-legislators fault call on Tinubu to resign over Kebbi, Kwara attacks . The National Forum of Former Legislators has dismissed calls for President Bola Ahmed Tari to resign . The Forum’s National Council of Ex-Legislators’ statement was made in a statement .

Title: 2027: Kwankwaso conditionally open for APC, says NNPP chair
Summary: Presidential candidate of the New Nigerian Peoples Party (NNPP) in the 2023 general elections, Dr Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso, is conditionally open for APC, says NNPP chair .

Title: Tinubu remains focused on child welfare amid security threats — Bagudu
Summary: President Bola Tinubu remains focused on child welfare amid security threats . Minister of Budget and Economic Planning, Senator Abubakar Bagudu, has prioritised the wellbeing of Nigerian children .

Title: Nose gear failure grounds flight in Enugu
Summary: An aircraft with registration number 5N-BZN suffered nose-landing gear malfunction while landing in Enugu . The aircraft was flying from Lagos to Enugu from Nigeria .

Title: Incessant system failures hampering port operations — Customs agents
Summary: The Association of Nigerian Licensed Customs Agents, ANLCA, is lamenting that the newly commissioned B’odogwu unified digital customs management system is suffering frequent down-time . They claimed that the platform has caused more financial losses due to delays in processing cargo clearance at the ports .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 21, 2025
Summary: The naira traded around ₦1,450 to the US dollar in Nigeria’s official Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) on Friday .

Title: CBN touts reform gains, seeks stronger fiscal–monetary alignment
Summary: Central Bank of Nigeria touts reform gains, seeks stronger fiscal–monetary alignment . CBN says ongoing reform measures are restoring stability to the economy . The bank stressed need for deeper coordination between fiscal and monetary authorities to sustain gains .

Title: Terrorists killed my five children, Benue attack survivor tells US Congress
Summary: Msurshima Apeh, a survivor of the June 2025 Yelwata attack in Benue State, recounted her harrowing ordeal before the United States Congress on Thursday . She said she watched the killing of her five children during the attack . The hearing focused on President Donald Trump’s decision to reinstate Nigeria on the Country

Title: Ogun CJ deploys magistrates to clear 201 cases, decongest prisons
Summary: The Chief Judge of Ogun State has deployed a special magistrates’ panel to preside over 201 cases in a 14-day accelerated hearing as part of the state judiciary’s intervention week . The intervention week has been scheduled to carry out a comprehensive decongestion exercise at the Sagamu Correctional Centre between Monday,

Title: VIDEO: Pope says violence in Nigeria affects Christians, Muslims
Summary: Pope Leo XIV has said that both Christians and Muslims “have been slaughtered” in Nigeria, linking the violence to extremist groups, economic and land-related conflicts . His comments come as international scrutiny over Nigeria’s security situation intensifies . U.S. President Donald Trump recently redesignated Nigeria a “Country of Part

Title: Miss Mexico wins Miss Universe contest after week of drama, accusations
Summary: Miss Mexico Fatima Bosch was crowned Miss Universe in Thailand on Friday . Organiser Nawat Itsaragrisil publicly chastised Miss Mexico during a dispute over her apparent failure to post promotional content on her social media . Title: C’River gov bags best food security award
Summary: Cross River Governor Bassey Otu received the Best Governor Award in Food Security at the Africa Food Heroes Awards on Thursday in Abuja . The awards, organised by the Centre for Agropreneurship and Green Economy, celebrate individuals and institutions advancing agriculture and food security in Nigeria .
